title: >>> New Year's REVOLUTION
body_text:
Never duplicated, never imitated. There is only one dodgeball league around.
The warriors of Wall High School attend the inaugural event of 2007, and leave with memories embedded into their minds forever.
This was DODGEBALL 71.
2007's First Records
> Attendance: 39
> Biggest Return: Ben Cotta (Last appearance at DODGEBALL LX3)
> New Players: (12) Alyssa Vetrano, Bobby Vetrano, Matt Johnson, Mike LoCascio, Brian Szczepanek, Danica Vitale, Kyle Sokolowski, Kati Sokolowski, Anthony Gentilello, Grant Cornero, Alex Jackson, Rachel Fondi.
- DODGEBALL 71 reached the 4th highest attendance of all-time (following 50, 41, and XTWO).
- This event also reached the 2nd highest newblood count following DODGEBALL 41 with 15.
- For the first time in 7 weeks, there was no
Prison Ball
.
- Though DODGEBALL 71 took place the first week in January, it was about 55 degrees out.
- DODGEBALL 71 ended at 11:48pm, the latest an event has ever ended.
- DODGEBALL 71 saw the debut of two new captains in new sensation Jeff Heimbuch and veteran Rob Avakian.
- Luke brought an amazing 9 free pizzas. He was given a nice tip for his generosity.
- Thanks are in order to Mike Butler for bringing large cases of iced tea and water.
Inaugural Match of 2007: Rob Avakian vs. Jeff Heimbuch
The new year couldn't have started any more wild. An incredible turnout, spring-like weather, plenty of free food and drinks, and a captains war never witnessed!
The stars came out for this one; Letsche, Basista, Kerr, Adams, DeCuir, Edwards, Larsen, Freda, Katz, Gassner ... the list is endless.
Blinding faceshots, paralyzing nutshots, and numbing V-shots could be heard a mile away. There was so much chaos in so little time that few knew where to look, where to dodge, or how to catch. Hell, the score itself was screwed up due to the complete insanity of DODGEBALL 71!
It took some time to get the facts right, but the end result was finally resolved.
>> High-flyin' Jeff Heimbuch defeated suicidal dodger Rob Avakian, 7 to 5.
Meredith Lewis's V-shots, John Tronolone in a garbage can, the re-newed rivalry between Steve Adams and Kevin Fitzpatrick ... There is no question that DODGEBALL 71 will go down as one of the most insane, action-packed, and overall memorable events in dodgeball's 1-year plus journey. The first event of 2007 may have hit a new high in the sport.
________________________________________
____________
New year, new additions! Legends voice their opinion on DODGEBALL 71!
"DODGEBALL 71 was an exciting yet grueling battle which brought out the best in every player. ... Overall, the game has improved greatly and seems to be more fun to everyone. Plus, switching between prison and regular dodgeball is exciting."
-
RYAN LETSCHE
"A high energy event with some extremely quick dodging. A team contribution on both sides. Lots of new people to add to the dodgeball community and to continue the new season of dodgeball ..."
-
DIANA DIBUCCIO
________________________________________
____________
Upcoming Event: DODGEBALL 72
November 2005. May 2006. The first and second peaks in dodgeball's life-changing run. Has the time come for Number 3?
Prepare for the 72nd installment coming to Wall High School,
January 13
.

The new year couldn't have started any more wild. An incredible turnout, spring-like weather, plenty of free food and drinks, and a captains war never witnessed!

The stars came out for this one; Letsche, Basista, Kerr, Adams, DeCuir, Edwards, Larsen, Freda, Katz, Gassner ... the list is endless.

It took some time to get the facts right, but the end result was finally resolved.
>> High-flyin' Jeff Heimbuch defeated suicidal dodger Rob Avakian, 7 to 5.

Meredith Lewis's V-shots, John Tronolone in a garbage can, the re-newed rivalry between Steve Adams and Kevin Fitzpatrick ... There is no question that DODGEBALL 71 will go down as one of the most insane, action-packed, and overall memorable events in dodgeball's 1-year plus journey.
